newsitem.title: INDIA: India '96/97 grains output seen up at 196 mln t.
newsitem.headline: India '96/97 grains output seen up at 196 mln t.

text.p: India's total foodgrains in 1996/97 (April-March) is expected to rise to 196.3 million tonnes against 185 million in the previous year, a research study said.

The Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE), an independent think-tank, said overall agricultural production in 1996/97 is expected to rise by 4.7 percent compared to a negative growth of 0.2 percent in the previous year.

The CMIE, in its report received by Reuters on Friday, estimated the kharif or winter foodgrains production at 103.6 million tonnes and the rabi or summer output at 92.7 million in 1996/97 against 97.7 million and 87.3 million respectively in the previous year.
It said widespread rains during the four-month June-September monsoon season had helped the kharif production.
The rabi crops are yet to be sown, but production estimates are normally based on the monsoon rains.
